definition: to read (honorific: e.g. your distinguished article)
to clasp/to cup the hands/to hold up with both hands/to offer (esp. in cupped hands)/to praise/to flatter
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
comma/phrase marked by pause

sentences.english: Read it, I know you will love it.
sentences.chinese: 捧读它吧，我敢打赌你一定会爱不释手。

sentences.english: Each time reads respectfully these letters, always lets me think one kind of special excitement.
sentences.chinese: 每次捧读这些信件，总让我觉得一种特殊的激动。

sentences.english: It always gives me extraordinary thrill to read their letters.
sentences.chinese: 每次捧读这些信件，总让我觉得一种特殊的激动。

definition: lit. always with a book in hand (idiom)/fig. (of a student or scholar) diligent and hardworking
(polite) to read (sth)
to stop reading
to be worth reading a hundred times (idiom)
to read again/to review (a lesson etc)
to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
to thumb through/to flip through (a book)
manuscript of a book
Guwen Guanzhi, an anthology of essays written in Literary Chinese, compiled and edited by Wu Chucai and Wu Diaohou of Qing dynasty
volume/scroll
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
comma/phrase marked by pause
to make a living by writing/to write (as an author)
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
verse manuscript
stress (on a syllable)
